result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Thomas Bach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to sentence currently being served.

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Thomas Bach

records.addlTxt: 2:37 PM Defendant Brandon Thomas Bach in court, in custody with the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Walter Isaacson, for attorney Ryan W O'Hara, in court for Brandon Thomas Bach.  Attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty; Court finds defendant guilty.  Defendant waives right to presentence investigation.  Court orders sentence withheld, 2 years probation, consecutive to sentence currently being served, any treatment deemed necessary, absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, costs due to Clerk of Court, 0 days sentence credit.

10:03AM Defendant Brandon Thomas Bach appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara in court for Brandon Thomas Bach.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Calendar call on September 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Calendar call on August 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Activity:  Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:25 AM Defendant Brandon Thomas Bach in court in custody, by video with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video.  Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on February 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Activity:Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:45 PM Defendant Brandon Thomas Bach in court by video in custody with attorney Kevin M Smith by video.  Richard Jay Sullivan and Margaret Ginocchio  appeared by videofor the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $1000 set with conditions of no contact with Dicks Sporting Goods and Target. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom.
No contact with Dicks Sporting Goods or Target.
